title: What is something you discovered that led to a bigger discovery? - Quora

response.answer_text: That the “self’ or a “being” is fractal in nature. As Søren Kierkegaard wrote in “The Sickness Unto Death:” “The self is a relation which relates itself to its own self, or it is that in the relation that the relation relates itself to its own self; the self is not the relation but that the relation relates itself to its own self.” I’ve taken this into a more visual domain to communicate my current working definition of a self, and it looks something like this:  In this schematic, what I’m labeling as SELF might be what Sigmund Freud referred to as the Ego, the “I” in the statement “I am.” The OTHER is another self which a being can be in a relationship with. The above visualization depicts multiple selves within one being. This may be difficult for some to grasp: the concept of there being another self besides “I” within our being. Perhaps it may be easier to conceive of this configuration in the expanded form: a marriage. This looks something like this:  As depicted in the schematic above, this form of being is self-similar (i.e. fractal) in configuration to the individual beings of which it’s comprised. We have two individual beings, within a relationship, which compose a new being: a marriage. Expanded further, the Family can be visualized in the following way:  The above depicts how this configuration (in a simplistic form) demonstrates the same self-similarity. This pattern can continue to be expanded outward in networks of relationship, as well as inward when defining the other self (above labeled as SPIRIT, but could also be labeled as GOD). When considering the ramifications of an uncreated creator both indwelling our being, as well as connecting us within relationships to other beings and families, our “oneness” beings to take on a very literal and awe-inspiring quality (to say the least). If you follow that rabbit hole, you may never come out of wonderland.

What is something you discovered that led to a bigger discovery? I discovered the wisdom of Kabbalah—the science of the correct perception of true reality: what it is and how it is manifested, and it is leading me to the discovery of how to be like the Creator.
